Class TransactionService

java.lang.Object
Transactions.TransactionService
public class TransactionService extends Object
Service class for managing transactions in the Personal Budgeting Application.

This class provides the core functionality for:

  • Adding and tracking transactions
  • Managing recurring transactions
  • Automatically processing due transactions
  • Canceling scheduled recurring transactions

The service maintains two collections: all transactions and recurring transactions, and uses a scheduled executor to automatically process recurring transactions daily.

See Also:
  • Transaction
  • TransactionController

  • Constructor Details

    • TransactionService

      public TransactionService()
      Creates a new transaction service and starts the daily processing scheduler.

      This constructor initializes the transaction collections and sets up the scheduled task to process recurring transactions daily.

  • Method Details

    • addRecurringTransaction

      public void addRecurringTransaction(Transaction transaction)
      Adds a new recurring transaction to the service.

      The transaction is added to both the main transactions list and the recurring transactions list if it has a recurrence pattern.

      Parameters:
      transaction - The recurring transaction to add

    • processDueTransactions

      public void processDueTransactions()
      Processes all due recurring transactions for the current day.

      This method:

      1. Checks all recurring transactions for today's date
      2. Creates new transaction instances for each occurrence
      3. Updates recurring transactions to their next occurrence dates
      4. Deactivates completed recurring transactions

      This is automatically called daily by the scheduler.

    • cancelRecurringTransaction

      public boolean cancelRecurringTransaction(int id, String password)
      Cancels an active recurring transaction.

      This method deactivates a recurring transaction, preventing future occurrences. A password is required for security verification.

      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the recurring transaction to cancel
      password - The user's password for verification
      Returns:
      true if successfully canceled, false if not found or already inactive

    • getAllTransactions

      public List<Transaction> getAllTransactions()
      Retrieves all transactions in the system.
      Returns:
      A new list containing all transactions (one-time and recurring)

    • getActiveRecurringTransactions

      public List<Transaction> getActiveRecurringTransactions()
      Retrieves only active recurring transactions.
      Returns:
      A list of all active recurring transactions
